intro: Aloinopsis villetii, commonly known as the Cape Hare’s foot, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching growth habit. The plant features fleshy, triangular leaves that are typically green with red or purple margins. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Aloinopsis villetii is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
